intro: Caragana frutex subsp. frutex, commonly known as the shrub willow, is a deciduous shrub native to the temperate regions of Asia and North America. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features slender, often multi-branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the spring, followed by elongated, woody pods that contain several seeds. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a serrated margin, often turning yellow in the fall. Caragana frutex subsp. frutex is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in semi-arid environments.
